Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the extent of the changes made to the Social Security system over the years by implying that they have betrayed the original intent of the system.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to substantiate the assertion that changes to the Social Security system have betrayed its original intent.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that changes to the Social Security system have been made with the intention of betraying its original purpose, without providing evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations for the changes made to the Social Security system, such as evolving societal needs or economic factors.
